programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Edmonton gained a commanding 3-1 lead in the series with a 4-1 win over Dallas in Game 4 behind 28 saves from Stuart Skinner, along with a goal and an assist from Corey Perry; Jason Robertson scored the lone goal for the Stars in the loss.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Houston (4-5) ended a two-game skid with a 24-21 win over DC behind 255 total yards from Jalan McClendon; Michigan (6-3) is 3-1 at home, and defeated the Roughnecks, 30-18, on May 17 behind three passing touchdowns from Danny Etling.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's College World Series
programme.desc: No. 2 seed Oklahoma, No. 3 seed Florida, No. 6 seed Texas, No. 7 seed Tennessee, No. 9 seed UCLA, No. 12 seed Texas Tech, No. 16 seed Oregon and Ole Miss compete in the double-elimination format; Oklahoma is the four-time defending champion.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's College World Series
programme.desc: Oregon (53-8) won two of three meetings during the regular season, including a 9-0 victory in five innings on April 20; UCLA (54-11), which owns the record for the most national titles with 13, ousted South Carolina in the Columbia Super Regional.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: East Carolina (33-25) makes its seventh-straight NCAA Regional appearance and 35th in program history after winning the 2025 AAC Tournament title; Florida (38-20), which has won 18 of its last 24 games, has not missed the postseason since 2007.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Miami (Fla.) (31-24) makes its 50th NCAA Tournament appearance, tied for third most all-time behind only Texas (64) and Florida State (61); Alabama (41-16), which is 8-7 all-time against the Hurricanes, makes its third-straight postseason appearance.

programme.title: Squeeze Play
programme.desc: Whip-around coverage of the NCAA Baseball Championships, as 64 teams play in 16 regionals around the country with the winners advancing to the Super Regionals.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: The accomplishments and achievements of Iowa's Caitlin Clark, South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso and UCLA's Kiki Rice are chronicled as they go through the 2023-24 season, showcasing the memorable moments and record-breaking performances.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Formula 1 drivers learn the intricacies of the track and communicate to the crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race in Spain; crews work to set up car.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's College World Series
programme.desc: No. 3 seed Florida (48-16) was held to just two hits in a 3-0 loss to No. 6 seed Texas in Game 1; No. 7 seed Tennessee (45-16) allowed a three-run walk-off home run in a 4-3 loss to No. 2 seed and four-time defending champion Oklahoma in Game 2.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: The top collegiate pom dancing squads from across the country compete for the UDA national title, showcasing their skills and choreography to a panel of judges at the annual event who grade their performances under certain criteria.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.desc: In 1978, the Celtics drafted Larry Bird, but he played his final year at Indiana State before signing; Los Angeles selected Magic Johnson No. 1 in 1979 after he led Michigan State to a victory over Bird and the Sycamores in the NCAA title game.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series Qualifying
programme.desc: Drivers qualify for the Rackley Roofing 200 and the driver with the fastest time is awarded the pole position; Stewart Friesen averaged 158.98 mph en route to winning the pole at Nashville last year but would finish the race in 11th.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (6-2) won its last two games after a 33-30 win over Arlington behind 240 passing yards and two touchdowns from Jordan Ta'amu; Houston (3-5) dropped its last two games since beating Memphis, 21-20, on May 3 behind Jalan McClendon.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Washington won two of its three games against the Mariners last season in the interleague series, but the Mariners avoided a sweep at Nationals Park with a 9-5 victory in the finale of the three-game series.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Washington won two of its three games against the Mariners last season in the interleague series, but the Mariners avoided a sweep at Nationals Park with a 9-5 victory in the finale of the three-game series.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased his lead over Pato O'Ward to 97 points after an Indianapolis Grand Prix win, his fourth of the season; Josef Newgarden won the last two Indianapolis 500s after beating O'Ward last year.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: 100 Days to Indy
programme.desc: Multiple racing teams arrive at the Thermal desert for a shot at glory, but all eyes are on bitter rivals Team Penske and Chip Ganassi Racing, a longstanding feud that starts with a bang at the opening race in St. Petersburg.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim secured his fourth win of the season and second in the last four races with a dominant victory at Charlotte over Ross Chastain; Christian Eckes averaged 101.829 mph in his win at Nashville last year, beating Daniel Dye by 2.028 seconds.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series

programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Hawthorn (7-4-0) defeated the Magpies, 133-67, on July 20, as Jack Ginnivan amassed a career-high 31 disposals, 11 score involvements and two goals; Collingwood (9-2-0) has won three-straight after beating North Melbourne, 108-63, in Round 11.

programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: NHRA Pro Mod Series
programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.

programme.desc: The NRL stepped outside of Australia to open its 2024 season under the bright, neon lights of Las Vegas, as the documentary shows all-access footage and interviews with the people that made it happen and the players who got a unique experience.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: Atlético Ottawa claimed a 4-1 victory against Vancouver in their first meeting of the season on April 13, led by a goal and an assist from David Rodriguez; Kévin Santos, Ballou Tabla and Monty Mark Patterson rounded out the scoring in the win.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: HFX Wanderers claimed a 2-1 victory against York United in their first meeting of the season on April 13 after being down, 1-0, at half-time; Giorgio Probo and Tiago Coimbra found the net for HFX in the second half of the comeback win at home.

programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.desc: Adelaide (7-4-0) has won three of its last four contests after defeating West Coast, 128-62, on May 24; Sydney (4-7-0) has won the past six meetings, including a 121-90 triumph last season in Round 24, as Luke Parker had 19 disposals and three goals.

programme.desc: The life of Bob Quinn was much more than becoming a legend and captain for the Port Adelaide Football Club, serving his country of Australia during World War II and receiving the Military Medal for his actions during the Siege of Tobruk.

programme.desc: New Zealand (8-0-3) snapped an eight-match losing streak to the Rabbitohs with a 34-4 victory last season, as Shaun Johnson notched two tries and added five conversions; South Sydney (6-0-5), which comes off a bye in Round 12, has won two in a row.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Tigres and Cruz Azul played to a 1-1 draw in the first leg of the semi-final on April 23 where Juan José Purata equalized for Tigres in the 85th minute of play; Carlos Rotondi had broken the 0-0 deadlock in the 69th minute of the draw.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship
programme.desc: USA is coming off of finishing in third place at the 2024 World Cup through a 2-1 victory against the Netherlands after a winner scored in extra-time; Guyana claimed a 1-0 victory against Haiti in a qualification match on Feb. 25.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Vancouver claimed a 2-0 lead over Inter Miami in the first leg of the semi-final on April 24 with goals from Brian White and Sebastian Berhalter; Pedro Vite and Jayden Nelson provided the assists for the Whitecaps in the win at home.

programme.desc: The tournament, which features a $20 million purse, is one of only five events given "invitational" status by the PGA TOUR and includes a reduced field of just 69 golfers; Scottie Scheffler finished with a one-stroke victory in last year's edition.

programme.title: PGA Tour Champions Golf
programme.desc: Ernie Els of South Africa carded a 7-under 65 over the final round to remain atop the leaderboard at 21-under 195 to secure a two-stroke wire-to-wire victory over Stephen Ames in last year's edition; Els captured his fourth PGA Tour Champions title.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf
programme.desc: American John Catlin finished at 14-under 274 before defeating Maximilian Kieffer of Germany on the fifth play-off hole to win the tournament the last time it was played in 2021; Golfclub Gut Altentann last hosted the tournament in the 1992 edition.

programme.title: 2025 U.S. Women's Open Golf Championship
programme.desc: The event, which debuted in 1946 and features the largest purse in women's professional golf at $12 million, is the longest-running tournament currently on the LPGA Tour; Yuka Saso of Japan defeated Hinako Shibuno by three strokes in 2024.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
programme.desc: Professional golfers play a practice round of golf while discussing and breaking down the many aspects of their game, including different course strategies, practical tips for difficult situations, swing improvement, and much more.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler took home a $4 million payday after carding a 2-over 74 over the final round to remain atop the leaderboard at 8-under 280 to hold off Collin Morikawa for a one-shot victory in last year's edition of the tournament.

programme.title: Playing Lessons
